topic.title: ENET Runtime API

body.p: The following API provide set/get implementations of Ethernet related runtime operations. Specific parameters of the API described below are referenced throughout the ENET Subsystem functional description.

entry.p: Returns the configuration of the specified Ethernet channel
Configures the maximum receive unit of Ethernet packets in bytes.
Configures the Inter Packet Gap IPG length of the Ethernet packets. The default size is 12 bytes.
Configures the MAC for FCS (CRC) forwarding of the given channel.
Configures the MAC to insert FCS on Ethernet frames for the given channel.
Enables or disabled the physical PCS of the Ethernet channel. The PCS layer is automatically enabled during Ethernet provisioning. This API is intended for debugging purposes.
Configures the MAC Receive flow control decode operation. It decodes all the PAUSE frames as specified by the IEEE 802.3 standard.
Configures the MAC Receive to receive a fault ordered set of idles on the given channel.
Configures the MAC Transmit transmission of PAUSE control frames.
Configures the MAC Transmit to insert a fault ordered set or idles on a given channel.
Configures the MAC to enable or disable dropping of received errored frames for a given type of error.
Configures the timing mode for an ENET port.

section.title: g5_api_enet_chnl_cfg_get()
section.p: The g5_api_enet_chnl_cfg_get() API gets the configuration of the specified Ethernet channel. The API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:

The API accepts two input parameters and returns a pointer to a structure. The device_id is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the channel ID representing the ENET segment from which to be read.

The API returns a pointer to the g5_enet_cfg_get_t structure, cfg_ctrl. This pointer must be preallocated. The structure contains 10 elements which are detailed in Table 2. The g5_enet_cfg_get_t is used to return the complete configuration of an Ethernet channel. Most elements of this structure return the values of the ENET runtime set() functions.

entry.p: Maximum received until length set by g5_api_enet_mru_set()
FCS insert is enabled. Enabled by g5_api_enet_fcs_insert_set()
FCS insert is enabled. Enabled by g5_api_enet_fcs_insert_set()
Receive flow control enabled. Enabled by g5_api_enet_rx_fc_set()
Transmit flow control enabled. Enabled by g5_api_enet_tx_fc_set()
PCS layer enabled. Enabled by g5_api_enet_phy_en_set()
ENET fault patter transmitted as defined by enum g5_enet_pattern_t.
ENET fault pattern received as defined by enum g5_enet_pattern_t.
Bitfield of errors to drop. An enabled bit corresponds to the bit index from the enum g5_emac_error_t. Set by g5_api_enet_err_frm_set()

section.title: g5_api_enet_mru_set()
section.p: The g5_api_enet_mru_set() API configures the maximum receive unit of Ethernet packets in bytes. The API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:

It accepts three input parameters and does not return any outputs. The device_id is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the channel ID representing the ENET segment which will be configured. The max_length parameter is used to specify in bytes the length of the packet before an error is asserted. For this setting, a value of 10000 bytes is configured by default.

section.title: g5_api_enet_ipg_set()
section.p: The g5_api_enet_ipg_set() API configures the Inter Packet Gap IPG length of the Ethernet packets. The API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:

It accepts three input parameters and does not return any outputs. The device_id is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the channel ID representing the ENET segment which will be configured. The inter_packet_gap parameter is used to specify in bytes the inter packet gap length for the channel. For this setting, a value of 12 bytes is configured by default. For standard compliant Ethernet, set the average IPG to 12-bytes whenever the client packet stream is not rate limited by an upstream MAC(e.g., source stream coming from NPU via packet Interlaken interface). If the client packet stream is rate limited by passing through an upstream MAC in another device, set the average IPG to 11-bytes or lower to ensure the local device transmit MAC can keep up with processing the packet stream in the event that the upstream MAC has a faster reference clock offset than the local device.

section.title: g5_api_enet_fcs_fwd_set()
section.p: The g5_api_enet_fcs_fwd_set() API configures the receive MAC for FCS (CRC) forwarding of the given channel. The API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:

It accepts three input parameters and does not return any outputs. The device_id is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the channel ID representing the ENET segment which will be configured. The enable parameter is a boolean parameter which indicates whether the FCS forwarding is enabled or disabled by setting it to TRUE or FALSE respectively.

section.title: g5_api_enet_fcs_insert_set()
section.p: The g5_api_enet_fcs_insert_set() API configures the transmit MAC to insert FCS on Ethernet frames for the given channel. The API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:

It accepts three input parameters and does not return any outputs. The device_id is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the channel ID representing the ENET segment which will be configured. The enable parameter is a boolean parameter which indicates whether the FCS insertion is enabled or disabled by setting it to TRUE or FALSE respectively.

section.title: g5_api_enet_phy_en_set()
section.p: The g5_api_enet_phy_en_set() API enables or disabled the physical PCS of the Ethernet channel. The API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:

It accepts three input parameters and does not return any outputs. The device_id is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the channel ID representing the ENET segment which will be configured. The phy_enable parameter is a boolean parameter which indicates whether the PCS layer is enabled or disabled by setting it to TRUE or FALSE respectively. The PCS layer is automatically enabled during Ethernet provisioning. This API is intended for debugging purposes.

section.title: g5_api_enet_rx_fc_set()
section.p: The g5_api_enet_rx_fc_set() API configures the MAC Receive flow control decode operation. It decodes all the PAUSE frames as specified by the IEEE 802.3 standard. The API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:

It accepts three input parameters and does not return any outputs. The device_id is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the channel ID representing the ENET segment which will be configured. The fc_enable parameter is a boolean parameter which indicates whether flow control decoding is enabled or disabled by setting it to TRUE or FALSE respectively.

section.title: g5_api_enet_rx_pattern_set()
section.p: The g5_api_enet_rx_pattern_set() API configures the MAC Receive to receive a fault ordered set of idles on the given channel. The API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:

It accepts three input parameters and does not return any outputs. The device_id is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the channel ID representing the ENET segment which will be configured. The pattern_type parameter is set by the enumeration g5_enet_pattern_t that represents the ordered sets and idle patterns available for configuration. The choices are shown in Table 3 below.

section.title: g5_api_enet_tx_fc_set()
section.p: The g5_api_enet_tx_fc_set() API configures the MAC Transmit transmission of PAUSE control frames. The API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:

It accepts three input parameters and does not return any outputs. The device_id is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the channel ID representing the ENET segment which will be configured. The fc_enable parameter is a boolean parameter which indicates whether flow control transmission is enabled or disabled by setting it to TRUE or FALSE respectively.

section.title: g5_api_enet_tx_pattern_set()
section.p: The g5_api_enet_tx_pattern_set() API configures the MAC Transmit to insert a fault ordered set or idles on a given channel. The API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:

It accepts three input parameters and does not return any outputs. The device_id is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the channel ID representing the ENET segment which will be configured. The pattern_type parameter is set by the enumeration g5_enet_pattern_t that represents the ordered sets and idle patterns available for configuration. The choices are shown in Table 3

section.title: g5_api_enet_err_frm_set()
section.p: The g5_api_enet_err_frm_set() API configures the MAC to enable or disable dropping of received errored frames for a given type of error. The API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:

It accepts four input parameters and does not return any outputs. The device_id is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the channel ID representing the ENET segment which will be configured. The error_type parameter is set by the enumeration g5_emac_error_t that represents the EMAC error types available for configuration. The choices are shown in #ENET_G5_Defects_and_Performance_Monitori_2cirs0z29z/table_g5_emac_error_t_Enumeration_Parameter_la_5jfsoc1dt below. The drop_enable parameter is a boolean parameter which indicates whether a frame should be dropped based on a given error or masked by setting it to TRUE or FALSE respectively.

entry.p: EtherType Set when EtherType field is greater than 1500
VLAN Tagged Frame has one or more VLAN tags when detection enabled
Control Set when EtherType field is greater than 1536
FCS error (on a Per link basis). (set whether FCS is stripped or not as long as checking is enabled)
Jabber Frame length greater than Max Jabber Size
Packet length error (on a Per link basis). Set when EtherType field is less than or equal to 1500 and the frame size is less than the received length value
Pause Frame (When EtherType is 0x8808 and PAUSE frame check passes)

section.title: g5_api_enet_tx_timing_mode_set()
section.p: The g5_api_enet_tx_timing_mode_set() API configures the timing mode for an ENET port. This configuration only applies for MAC terminated ENET ports. If the ENET port has a demapped BMP or GMP data source connected at the OCPB, the ENET port's transmitter will be in transparent mode and the ENET port transmit timing will match the demapped xGE CBR data stream. Prior to the OCPB connection, BMP and GMP configured ENET ports will generate nominal transmit timing. If a SERDES receive to transmit loopback is configured, the transmit timing mode will not be immediately applied. When the loopback is disabled the last requested ENET transmit timing mode will be applied. The API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:

The device_id is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the channel ID representing the ENET segment which will be configured. The mode parameter is set by the enumeration g5_enet_tx_timing_mode_t that sets Ethernet TX_MAC transmit timing modes. These modes do not apply to an ENET port that has a BMP or GMP demapped data source, in these cases the transmit timing mode recovers the demapped application rate.

entry.p: Nominal timing is where the transmit data stream is timed from local reference clock.
PTP Timing is where a transmit data stream is timed with the PTP clock.
Transmit data stream is timed with 125MHz PTP_FW_PLL_FCLK[0] input pin.
Transmit data stream is timed with 125MHz PTP_FW_PLL_FCLK[1] input pin.
Loop timing is where each transmit data stream is timed from its partner receive data stream.
